name: EGRF v3.0 Corpus
description: Corpus of Existential Graph examples for testing EGRF v3.0

examples.title: Canonical Implication
examples.description: Standard form of implication using double-cut
examples.source: Canonical Forms, EGRF v3.0 Corpus, 2023

examples.title: Complex Relations Example
examples.description: Multiple predicates and cuts - comprehensive test case
examples.source: Canonical Forms, EGRF v3.0 Corpus, 2023

examples.title: Endoporeutic Game Starting Position
examples.description: Classic EPG starting position demonstrating quantifier scope ambiguity and multiple transformation paths
examples.source: Canonical EPG Examples, Endoporeutic Game Theory, 2024

examples.title: Modus Ponens (EPG Starter)
examples.description: Classic modus ponens setup for endoporeutic game practice
examples.source: Canonical Forms, EGRF v3.0 Corpus, 2023

examples.title: Simple Syllogism (EPG Starter)
examples.description: Classic syllogism setup for endoporeutic game practice
examples.source: Canonical Forms, EGRF v3.0 Corpus, 2023

examples.title: Nested Cuts Example
examples.description: Double-nested cuts with predicate - tests containment logic
examples.source: Canonical Forms, EGRF v3.0 Corpus, 2023

examples.title: Roberts' Disjunction Example
examples.description: Roberts' example of disjunction: 'P or Q'
examples.source: Don D. Roberts, The Existential Graphs of Charles S. Peirce, 1973, p.57

examples.title: Simple Predicate
examples.description: Basic predicate with constant - good for testing containment
examples.source: Canonical Forms, EGRF v3.0 Corpus, 2023

examples.title: Sowa's Quantification Example
examples.description: Sowa's example of existential quantification
examples.source: John F. Sowa, Peirce's Tutorial on Existential Graphs, 2011, p.356

examples.title: 4: Star pattern - one vertex connected to many predicates

examples.title: Peirce's Man-Mortal Implication
examples.description: Peirce's classic example of implication: 'If a man, then mortal'
examples.source: Charles Sanders Peirce, Collected Papers, 1903

examples.title: Peirce's Modus Ponens
examples.description: Peirce's demonstration of the modus ponens inference rule using existential graphs
examples.source: Charles Sanders Peirce, Collected Papers, 1906, p.572

examples.title: Dau's Ligature Example
examples.description: Dau's example of ligatures crossing cut boundaries
examples.source: Frithjof Dau, Mathematical Logic with Diagrams, 2006, p.112

examples.title: Dau's Theorem Proving Example
examples.description: Complex nested quantifier structure demonstrating theorem proving capabilities in EG
examples.source: Frithjof Dau, Mathematical Logic with Diagrams, 2006, p.Chapter on Existential Graph Inference

examples.title: Dau's Theorem Proving Example
